bio:treatment.description: Plants usually perennial, sometimes annual. Spikelets elliptic to lanceolate, more or less terete initially, sometimes becoming laterally compressed at anthesis, with (3)4-14(16) florets. Lower glumes 1-3-veined; upper glumes 3-5-veined; lemmas elliptic to lanceolate, rounded over the midvein, apices subulate, acute, obtuse or rounded, entire or slightly emarginate; awns straight, arising less than 1.5 mm below the lemma apices.
bio:treatment.discussion: Bromus sect. Bromopsis is sometimes incorrectly called sect. Pnigma Dumort. It is native to Eurasia as well as to North and South America, and has about 90 species.
